intro: Crossandra strobilifera var. brevis, commonly known as the short-strobilifera crossandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to thrive in well-drained, sunny conditions.
